snippet: The Israeli Supreme Court last week rejected an appeal for damages by the family of Rachel Corrie, a young American woman who was run over by a military bulldozer in Gaza in 2003 as she protested Israeli Army actions there.
abstract: Israeli Supreme Court's upholding of 2012 ruling that Israel bears no responsibility for death of Rachel Corrie, young woman run over by military bulldozer in Gaza in 2003, has drawn protests from family and from Human Rights Watch; Corrie was in Gaza to protest Israeli military actions there.
lead_paragraph: The Israeli Supreme Court last week rejected an appeal for damages by the family of Rachel Corrie, a young American woman who was run over by a military bulldozer in Gaza in 2003 as she protested Israeli Army actions there.

headline.main: Israeli Court Ruling on Protester’s Death Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Israeli Court Ruling on Protester’s Death Is Criticized

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
